pred_item.label: Extended-Release Naltrexone (XR-NTX)
pred_item.description: Participants with HIV and opioid use disorder randomized to receive HIV clinic-based extended-release naltrexone (XR-NTX), which requires complete cessation of opioid use prior to induction. XR-NTX is a deep muscle injection that lasts 28 days.

pred_item.label: Treatment-as-Usual (Opioid Agonist Therapy)
pred_item.description: Participants with HIV and opioid use disorder randomized to treatment-as-usual, which includes opioid agonist therapy with buprenorphine or methadone.

ref_item.name: Naltrexone Injectable Suspension
ref_item.description: Six monthly injections of extended-release naltrexone

pred_item.name: Extended-Release Naltrexone (XR-NTX)
pred_item.description: A deep intramuscular injection of extended-release naltrexone administered once every 28 days. An opioid antagonist that blocks opioid receptors. Requires complete opioid abstinence for several days prior to first injection to avoid precipitated withdrawal.

ref_item.name: Treatment as usual
ref_item.description: Standard treatment for opioid use disorder provided at each HIV clinic

pred_item.name: Methadone
pred_item.description: An opioid full agonist used for medication-assisted treatment of opioid use disorder. Requires daily dosing at specialized treatment programs.

ref_item.measure: Number of Participants With HIV Viral Suppression, Missing Imputed as Unsuppressed
Number of Participants With HIV Viral Suppression, Complete Case

pred_item.description: Receipt of first XR-NTX injection following opioid withdrawal and meeting opioid-free requirements
pred_item.timeFrame: At induction (following withdrawal period, typically 7-14 days)

ref_item.measure: Number of Participants With HIV Viral Suppression, Per-protocol

ref_item.description:
Absolute value of participant VACS Index at baseline and 24 weeks

Veterans Aging Cohort Study Index Minimum value: 0 Maximum value: 164 A higher score means a worse outcome.

Cluster of Differentiation 4

Absolute value of CD4 count at baseline and 24 weeks.

ref_item.measure: Engagement in HIV Care: Antiretroviral Therapy Prescribed
ref_item.description: Absolute value of participants prescribed ART at baseline and within 24 weeks following randomization. Each individual can be scored 0 (not prescribed ART) or 1 (prescribed ART) at both baseline and follow-up, after which his or her outcome score will be the follow-up score minus the baseline score. Outcomes will be analyzed via rank-based methods such as Wilcoxon rank-sum tests.

ref_item.measure: Engagement in HIV Care: 100% Antiretroviral Therapy Adherence
ref_item.description: Number of participants taking 100% of prescribed ART doses in the past month at 24 weeks for those prescribed ART at any point during the 24 week trial (proportion; self-reported medication adherence measure). Chi-squared test comparing proportion to treatment assignment, for those prescribed ART.

ref_item.measure: Number of Participants With at Least 1 HIV Care Visit in Past 12 Weeks
ref_item.description: At least 1 HIV care visit in past 12 weeks

ref_item.measure: Number of Participants Who Had Unprotected Sex in Past 30 Days
ref_item.description: Past 30 day unprotected sex, as measured by the Risk Assessment Battery at baseline and week 24 (binary; self-report).

ref_item.measure: Number of Participants With Multiple Sex Partners in Past 30 Days
ref_item.description: Past 30 day multiple sex partners, as measured by the Risk Assessment Battery at baseline and week 24 (binary; self-report).

ref_item.measure: Engagement in HIV Care: Quality of Life
ref_item.description:
Past 30 day health-related quality of life as measured by the EQ-5D questionnaire at baseline and week 24.

Minimum value: 0 Maximum value: 100 Higher scores mean a better outcome

ref_item.measure: Average Number of Self-Reported Days of Opioid Use in Last 30 Days
ref_item.description: Average number of days of opioid use between baseline and 24 weeks, measured by the Timeline Follow-Back (count; self-report), will be used to compare opioid use by treatment group. Confirmatory analysis will assess opioid use by the average number of days of opioid use in the last 30 days of the study (by Addiction Severity Index-lite; count; self-report) and the number of monthly urine drug screen (UDS) negative for opioids between baseline and 24 weeks (count; laboratory data).

pred_item.measure: Patient-reported experiences with XR-NTX induction process
pred_item.description: Qualitative themes identified through semi-structured interviews regarding facilitators and barriers to XR-NTX induction, including motivation, withdrawal experience, support systems, and treatment preferences
pred_item.timeFrame: Interviews conducted between July 2018 and November 2019 during or after induction attempts

ref_item.measure: Number of Participants Who Test Positive for Opioids at 24 Weeks
ref_item.description: Number and percent of participants with UDS positive for opioids at 24 weeks.

pred_item.description: Qualitative themes identified through interviews regarding barriers preventing completion of XR-NTX induction, including withdrawal concerns, ambivalence about stopping opioids, concerns about XR-NTX effects, and preferences for other medications
pred_item.timeFrame: Interviews conducted between July 2018 and November 2019 following unsuccessful induction attempts
